result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Sandlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel R Sandlin in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 14CF277 & 14CF424.  Rights/Elements.  In 14CF277  Defendant plead no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence: 15 days jail with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence.  $443.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Court.  Jail credit 3 days.  Start on 12-26-14 at 7:00 pm.   Case 14CF424  defendant plead no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence: Ct. 2  45 days jail with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence.  $443.00 costs/60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Court.  Jail credit 4 days.  Start 12/26/14 at 7:00 pm.  Dismiss but read in Ct. 1.
charge is now a misd. not a felony.  Bond has been amended to show defendant may travel out of state.  All other prior conditions remain.

Defendant Daniel R Sandlin in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Criminal Complaint filed.  Charge amended from a felony to a misd.  Waives reading.  Atty Riek requested a new pretrial and return date.  New bond set to remove out of state travel restriction.  All prior bond conditions remain.
Defendant Daniel R Sandlin in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.
